messages.title: Help get rid of Labour
messages.content: May 1st 2008 was a watershed in British politics. For the first time London elected a Conservative Mayor, Boris Johnson, and re-elected Conservative Brian Coleman to represent Camden on the Assembly. The results from the European Parliament Elections here in Holborn & St Pancras show that there's all to play for in this area. The choice at the next election is simple - five more years of Gordon Brown or a fresh start under the Conservatives.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet primarily focuses on the achievements of the Conservative Party such as electing a Conservative Mayor and re-electing a Conservative member to represent Camden on the Assembly. It emphasizes the long period Labour has been in control both in the government and locally in Camden. It calls for support to get rid of Labour in Camden and mentions donation requests for the campaign.
